intro: Microstylis venosa, commonly known as the veined microstylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. Microstylis venosa is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands.
